column6: Modeling and Learning in Data Science
column7: Introduction to the use of classical approaches in data modeling and machine learning in the context of solving data-centric problems. A broad coverage of fundamental models is presented, including linear models, unsupervised learning, supervised learning, and deep learning. A significant emphasis is placed on the application of the models in Python and the interpretability of the results. Prerequisite: STAT 207; one of MATH 225, MATH 257, MATH 415, MATH 416, ASRM 406.
column9: Prerequisite: STAT 207; one of MATH 225, MATH 257, MATH 415, MATH 416, ASRM 406.
